intro: Kyllinga mindorensis, commonly known as Mindanao grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the Philippines, particularly found in the island of Mindanao. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Kyllinga mindorensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
